member.name: T:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport
member.summary: Represents a report list that contains all information stored in Dundas OLAP Services.
member.remarks:
The OlapReport class stores all information required to generate an OLAP report. This includes the cube to get data from, and the dimensions that should be placed on the series and categorical axis. Additional information like the sort and filter status, the chart template and others are also stored in the OlapReport.
The OlapReport class is used in the to define the current OLAP report. Use the method to change the current OLAP report. The property of the OlapManager may store a list of available reports.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport.DataTitleFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the report title format.
member.value: A string value that represents the report title format.
member.remarks:
Special keywords can be inserted in this text that will be updated based on the data shown in the report. For example, the default format is "#MEASURES by #DIMENSIONS" and it shows the names of currently displayed measures and dimensions.
The following table displays a list of keywords and its descriptions:
Keyword Description
#MEASURES List of displayed measure names.
#DIMENSIONS List of displayed dimension names.
#SERIES_DIMENSIONS List of displayed series dimension names.
#CATEGORICAL_DIMENSIONS List of displayed categorical dimension names.
#SLICER_DIMENSIONS List of displayed slicer dimension names.
#SORTING_AND_FILTERING Sorting and filtering conditions.
#SORTING Sorting conditions.
#FILTERING Value filtering conditions.
#FILTERING_TOP_BOTTOM Top/bottom filtering conditions.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that indicates if the report is read-only.
member.value: A boolean value that indicates if the report is read-only.
member.remarks: When the report is marked as read-only, the end user cannot modify, rename or delete it using the OLAP client UI controls.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport.NonEmptyCellsOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that indicates if only non-empty cells should be displayed in the resulting cellset.
member.value: A boolean value that indicates if only non-empty cells should be displayed in the resulting cellset.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to false, all cells in the cellset are displayed. When this property is set to true, all rows or columns that contain empty cells are removed.
Note that rows and columns will not be removed if they contain at least one non-empty cell.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport.ChartTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart template used in the report.
member.remarks:
The chart templates will automatically be created and/or persisted when the end-user works with the OLAP report. Also, the chart template can be created using the SaveTemplateIntoString method of the OlapChart control.
You can make a report current by using the method of the OlapManager.
If this property is not empty, the template data is loaded into the chart control when the report becomes current.
member.value: A string value that represents a chart template.

member.summary: Gets the control state bag used for saving and loading the appearance state from additional controls such as OlapGrid.
member.value: The control state bag.

member.name: T:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager
member.summary: Represents the OLAP Manager, the key middle component of Dundas OLAP Services.
member.remarks:
The OLAP Manager is the middleware component that acts as a link between the user interface controls and the underlying data. Using this control, the developer can perform all available functionality provided in Dundas OLAP Services.
To create a customized OLAP solution, the developer can:
1. Use a subset of the distributed Dundas OLAP Services UI controls (OLAP Chart, Cube Selector, Axis Builder, Dimension Browser and Report List).
2. Build customized user-interface controls.
In both scenarios, all UI components must be connected to the OLAP Manager.

member.remarks:
Special keywords can be inserted in this text that will be updated based on the data shown in the report. For example, the default format is "#MEASURES by #DIMENSIONS" and it shows the names of currently displayed measures and dimensions.
The following table displays a list of keywords and its descriptions:
Keyword Description
#MEASURES List of displayed measure names.
#DIMENSIONS List of displayed dimension names.
#SERIES_DIMENSIONS List of displayed series dimension names.
#CATEGORICAL_DIMENSIONS List of displayed categorical dimension names.
#LEVELS List of displayed levels names.
#SERIES_LEVELS List of displayed series levels names.
#CATEGORICAL_LEVELS List of displayed categorical levels names.
#SLICER_LEVELS List of displayed slicer levels names.
#SORTING_AND_FILTERING Sorting and filtering conditions.
#SORTING Sorting conditions.
#FILTERING Value filtering conditions.
#FILTERING_TOP_BOTTOM Top/bottom filtering conditions.

member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.SetCurrentOlapReport(Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapReport,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the current OlapReport.
member.param: An object to be set as the current report of the OLAP Manager.
member.remarks:
The OLAP Manager always works with a single report called the CurrentOlapReport. When a report is made current, all components associated with the OLAP Manager are automatically updated to display the new data.
The read-only property can be used to access the current report.

member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.IsMultipleSlicerMemberSelectionAllowed
member.summary: Gets a flag if multiple members selection in the slicer axis is allowed.
member.returns: Returns true if multiple members selection in the slicer axis is allowed.
member.remarks:
Not all data providers allow selection of multiple members from the same dimension in the slicer axis. This method will return true when:
1. The data provider supports selection of multiple members from the same dimension on the slicer axis.
2. The property is set to true.

member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.IsNotificationsEnabled

member.returns: True if notification events are active

member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Maintains performance while the current report settings are changed by temporarily disabling notification events.
member.remarks:
When the and properties are changed, or the , or methods are called, the OlapManger raises notification events to notify the associated components.
When a series of changes is required, these notifications and updates in the associated components may affect performance. The BeginUpdate method temporarily disables the notification events until the method is called.

member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.EndUpdate
member.summary: Resumes notifications after they are suspended by the method call.
member.remarks:
When the and properties are changed, or the , or methods are called, the OlapManger raises notification events to notify the associated components.
When a series of changes is required, these notifications and updates in the associated components may affect performance. The method temporarily disables the notification events until the EndUpdate method is called.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.CurrentOlapReport
member.summary: Gets the current OLAP Report.
member.value: An value that defines the current OlapReport.
member.remarks:
The CurrentOlapReport object stores the current settings of the cube name, the axis descriptors, the chart template, the expanded members, and other relevant information.
This property is read-only. The method sets the current report, automatically updating all of the UI components associated with this OLAP Manager.
Note: When updating the axis descriptors of the current report, the , and methods should be used so that the UI components associated with this OLAP Manager will automatically be updated.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.OlapReports
member.summary: Represents the report list of the OlapManager.
member.value: An object that contains a list of available reports.
member.remarks:
Reports in the report list can be exposed to the end user using the OlapReportList control. This control can be used to add, remove, rename and change the current report.
Reports in the list can be saved or loaded from a file or a stream using the and methods.

member.value: An object that is used when a new report is created by the end-user in the OlapReportList control.
member.remarks: This report defines the initial settings (title, axis descriptors, chart template, etc.) of the new reports added by the end-user in the OlapReportList control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.OlapManager.AutoGenerateFirstQuery
member.summary: Indicates that if the current report axis descriptors are empty, the dimension descriptors will automatically be added from the current cube to generate the initial data query.
member.value: A boolean value that indicates if the empty axis descriptors should automatically be filled.
member.remarks:
If the current report's Categories and Series objects do not contain any objects, there is nothing to request from the data source.
Setting this property to true avoids the 'empty' view when the end-user loads a new report or switches the current OLAP cube.

member.summary: Represents the current cube name of the OlapManager.
member.value: A string value that represents the current multidimensional cube name.
member.remarks:
A list of all available cubes can be retrieved using the method.
If the CubeSelector control is associated with the OLAP Manager, this property will be linked with the cube name selected in that control. Any changes in the UI control will automatically be updated in that property and vice versa.
Some data providers may not support mutiple cubes, in which case this property is ignored. This property checks the property to see if the current DataProvider supports multiple cubes.

member.name: T:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings
member.summary: Represents an object that exposes a number of properties that define how data is shown in the Cube Dimension Browser controls.
member.remarks: The CubeDimensionBrowser and AxisBuilder controls share the same settings that define how different metadata elements are shown in the Cube Dimension Browser.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.AllowMultipleSlicerMemberSelection
member.summary: Defines if multiple member selection from the same dimension on the slicer axis is allowed.
member.value: Returns true if multiple members from the same dimension can be selected on the slicer axis.
member.remarks: Setting the AllowMultipleSlicerMemberSelection propery to true is only valid when the current data provider supports that feature. This can be checked using the SupportsMultipleSlicerMemberSelection property of the data provider.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.AllowMultipleHierarchiesFromSameDimensionOnAxis
member.summary: Defines if multiple hierarchies from the same dimension can be placed on the same or different axes.
member.value: Returns true if multiple hierarchies from the same dimension can be placed on the same or different axes.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.ShowLevelCaptionInDimensionDescriptor
member.summary: Indicates that level caption should be shown instead of the dimension caption on the axis DimensionDescriptor button.
member.value: Returns true if Levle caption should be shown on the DimensionDescriptor button.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.ShowNamedSets
member.summary: Defines if NamedSets are shown in the CubeDimensionBrowser and which folder will contain them.
member.value: A value that is used to determine if named sets are shown in the Cube Dimension Browser.
member.remarks: Named sets can be shown in the special root folder 'NamedSets' and/or inside associated their associated dimensions.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.ShowMeasuresInFolders
member.summary: Gets or sets the FolderUsageCondition that defines if measures are shown in folders within the CubeDimensionBrowser.
member.value: A value that is used to determine if measures are shown in folders within the CubeDimensionBrowser.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.ShowHierarchiesInFolders
member.summary: Gets or sets the FolderUsageCondition that defines if hierarchies are shown in folders inside the CubeDimensionBrowser.
member.value: A value that is used to determine if hierarchies are shown in folders inside the CubeDimensionBrowser.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Manager.CubeBrowserSettings.ShowAttributeHierarchies
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that indicates if attribute hierarchies should be shown in the CubeDimensionBrowser.
member.value: A boolean value that is used to determine if attribute hierarchies are shown inside the cube dimension browser.
